definition: peer/one's contemporary/person of the same age

sentences.english: Chinese women have become more like their Western equivalents, making the gap less nerve-wracking to cross.
sentences.chinese: 中国的女人也越来越像西方的同龄人，差异更小。

sentences.english: But Wang's peers didn't think he deserved a strong punishment.
sentences.chinese: 但王林的同龄人却不认为他应受重罚。

sentences.english: BRIAN: I watch my contemporaries, and they love to live in the studio and I don't. I have a life.
sentences.chinese: 我看周围的同龄人，他们喜欢住在工作室里。

sentences.english: They are more inclined to blow away the cobwebs than my contemporaries.
sentences.chinese: 他们比我的同龄人更执著于去呼出自己的声音。

sentences.english: There are many ways for homeschoolers to meet other kids.
sentences.chinese: 有很多方法可以让在家上学的孩子认识其他同龄人。

sentences.english: they need to be able to talk through that problem  with their peers.
sentences.chinese: 他们要学会怎样和同龄人沟通解决问题。

sentences.english: It means conforming to the norms of peers behaviourally.
sentences.chinese: 它意味着认可同龄人的行为规则。

sentences.english: Faced with honor, Tongshi a strong performance over the cooling-off peers.
sentences.chinese: 面对荣誉，童世强表现出了超过同龄人的冷静。

sentences.english: Esther has always jumped ahead of her peers.
sentences.chinese: 埃丝特一直都比同龄人学得快。

sentences.english: He loved the same kungfu movies and video games as other boys.
sentences.chinese: 和其他同龄人一样，他也喜欢武打片和电子游戏。

sentences.english: And that is the one big taboo of our age.
sentences.chinese: 而且这也是我们同龄人的一个大忌讳。

sentences.english: This candidness can cause problems in their relationships with their peers or loved ones.
sentences.chinese: 这坦率可能会导致与他们的同龄人的关系问题或亲人。

sentences.english: Instantly lies in ruins, microcontinent, my peers.
sentences.chinese: 顷刻间废墟一片，林浩，我的同龄人。

sentences.english: People who are too happy die younger than their more downbeat peers, claims new research.
sentences.chinese: 新研究称，太快乐的人比悲观的同龄人死得早。

sentences.english: Use your peers’ laziness to your advantage and apply for some free money!
sentences.chinese: 快点充分利用你同龄人的懒惰，申请一些无偿款项吧。

sentences.english: My son will not assort with people of his own age.
sentences.chinese: 我儿子决不和他的同龄人交往。

definition: how old are you? (familiar, or to a child)
variant of 歲|岁[sui4], year/years old
classifier for years (of age)/year/year (of crop harvests)
to get married and have kids/to start a family
